conclusion: Need to calculate the area under the velocity-time graph from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds to determine the distance fallen.
Graph is a curve starting from the origin (0,0) and reaching a velocity of 20 m/s at t = 10 seconds.
Graph can be approximated as a triangle for simplicity in calculation.
Base of the triangle is the time interval from 0 to 10 seconds, which is 10 seconds.
Height of the triangle is the maximum velocity reached at t = 10 seconds, which is 20 m/s.
Area of the triangle is calculated using the formula A = 1/2 * base * height.
Substituting the values gives A = 1/2 * 10 s * 20 m/s = 100 m.
Distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is exactly 100 meters.
